header.#text:
Committee review
			 of direct spending programs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or the

with jurisdiction over any program being
			 reauthorized shall consider the following criteria in determining whether such
			 program should be modified, terminated, or reauthorized:

text.#text: Any committee of the

The effectiveness
			 and efficiency of the operation of the program.

Whether the
			 program is cost effective.

Whether the
			 original objectives of the program have been achieved.

Whether
			 alternative methods exist to carry out the objectives of the program in a more
			 cost effective manner.

The extent to
			 which the program is duplicative or conflicts with other programs.

The potential
			 benefits of consolidating this program with similar or duplicative
			 programs.

The growth in cost
			 per beneficiary or persons served by the program.

The extent to
			 which any trends, developments, and emerging conditions may affect the problems
			 or needs that the program is intended to address.

The extent it
			 imposes mandates on State and local governments.

The extent it
			 impedes sustainable economic growth.

The extent to
			 which the program is a constitutionally authorized activity of the
			 Government.

text.#text:
Whenever a Member or Senator, as the case
				may be, offers an amendment to a bill that reduces the amount of budget
				authority for direct spending provided either under current law or proposed to
				be provided by the bill under consideration, that Member or Senator may state
				the portion of such reduction achieved in the first year covered by the most
				recently adopted concurrent resolution on the budget and in addition the
				portion of such reduction achieved in the first ten years covered by the most
				recently adopted concurrent resolution on the budget that shall be credited to
				the first-year deficit reduction balance and the five-year deficit reduction
				balance, as applicable, if the amendment is agreed to.

that the

text.#text: if the

necessary because

necessary for the
				enforcement of criminal laws;

necessary for
				national security; or

issued pursuant to
				any statute implementing an international trade agreement; or

when the new
				budget authority to carry out the rule is provided by law.

A
				rule that does not take effect (or does not continue in effect) under this
				section may not be reissued in substantially the same form, and a new rule that
				is substantially the same as such a rule may not be issued, unless the reissued
				or new rule is specifically authorized by a law enacted after the date that the
				rule fails to take effect or fails to continue in effect.

Any determination under this section shall be subject to
